properties.title: Harriet Kezaabu
properties.description: "I am committed to ensuring that the needs of women and girls are prioritized in emergencies because of their defenselessness and susceptibility to greater risk of sexual and economic exploitation. This infringes on their human rights and greatly impedes the woman’s dignity. Regardless of emergency situations, women and girls deserve equal access to resources and services like their male counterparts."

properties.title: Dr. Chris Baguma
properties.description: "Si un humain mérite d’être honoré, c’est d’abord la femme. Elle mérite honneur, respect, protection et considération."

properties.title: Patrique Lulizene
properties.description: "Je me suis donné pour mission de veiller à ce que les besoins des femmes et des filles soient traités en priorité en situations d’urgence car elles sont les garantes de la génération nouvelle malgré les événements les ciblant davantage."

properties.title: Raymond Chubaka Mukengere
properties.description: "Ma motivation, c'est pour soutenir cette couche sociale composée de filles et de femmes qui sont souvent marginalisées par les mœurs et coutumes, surtout pendant les catastrophes naturelles et les conflits. Bref, soutenir les femmes et les filles, c'est soutenir toute la communauté dans tous ses projets présents, futurs proches et futurs lointains."

properties.title: Mirella Papinutto
properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because they play a pivotal role in society. We must help them rebuild their sense of belonging. I am struck most by their courage and will to go on living without giving up. These women and girls ask themselves many questions about their future, but also find the answers themselves."

properties.title: Job Makoyo
properties.description: "I believe that building the humanitarian community’s capacity to recognize and address the needs of women and girls in emergencies is critical because women and girls’ needs during emergencies have not been prioritized and many continue to suffer due to the inability of humanitarian actors to adequately respond."

properties.title: Jacinta Maingi
properties.description: "I believe that building the humanitarian community’s capacity to recognize and address the needs of women and girls in emergencies is critical because safeguarding their dignity and empowerment is a crucial and vital ingredient for rebuilding of a nation. In general, the status of women and girls is trivialized, thus, making their ability to thrive in emergency situations a challenge. But, sustainable development can only be achieved when women and girls have access to knowledge, protection and resources."

properties.title: Henrietta Punni
properties.description: "I am committed to ensuring that the needs of women and girls are prioritized in emergencies because they have multiple needs during crisis, and are not prioritized for immediate support. Women and girls often suffer additional violence in seeking to access care and support."

properties.title: Jean Nimubona
properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because it is not only the right thing to do, but it is crucial for humanitarian well-being and development"

properties.title: Nyasha Mutongwizo
properties.description: "I feel that we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because over time emergencies shall continue to occur: man-made or natural disasters. The prioritization of women and girls' protection is, therefore, a commitment needed from all. In an emergency setting, pre-existing vulnerabilities are exacerbated. Not everyone is equally vulnerable. We can and should do so much more in preparedness and response to address disparities in vulnerability."

properties.title: Grace Chirewa
properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because emergencies, by their very nature, weaken the safety nets for women and girls. The vulnerability of girls is, thereby, increased. Many protection incidents fall through the cracks as most women and girls are unaware that they can get help and protection from abuse and may not know where to go in order to access the wide range of services available."

properties.title: Margaret Aleper
properties.description: "I am committed to ensuring that the needs of women and girls are prioritized in emergencies because women and girls are the most affected due to their sex, nature of their work like looking after children, collecting firewood, fetching water and they are sole providers in communities. In emergencies women and girls are defenseless and some time they become the most vulnerable group among the affected communities. Women and girls’ needs in emergencies are ignored by communities and even service providers."

properties.title: Acire Geoffrey Agula
properties.description: "I am committed to ensuring that the needs of women and girls are prioritized in emergencies because it is a life saving Intervention."

properties.title: Serge Dalexis
properties.description: "Selon moi, il est fondamental de renforcer les capacités de la communauté humanitaire pour répondre aux besoins des femmes et des filles en situations d'urgence car elles ne vivent pas les mêmes expériences. Il est primordial de veiller à ce que leurs besoins soient inventoriés et satisfaits au plus vite. Je pense que nous pouvons, et devrions, faire davantage pour assurer la sécurité des femmes et des filles en situations d’urgence."

properties.title: Hubert Zirimwabagabo
properties.description: "I believe that building the humanitarian community’s capacity to recognize and address the needs of women and girls in emergencies is critical because SGBV cases are often neglected during emergency response and it is really important that humanitarian workers should be able to advocate and respond effectively in this sense."

properties.title: Leonie Kahigwa
properties.description: "Selon moi, il est fondamental de renforcer les capacités de la communauté humanitaire pour évaluer et satisfaire les besoins des femmes et des filles en situations d'urgence car la communauté humanitaire à ces jours traite des besoins des populations sans accent particulier aux besoins des femmes et des filles. Je pense que nous pouvons, et devrions, faire davantage pour assurer la sécurité des femmes et des filles en situation d’urgence en impliquant les communautés à veiller à leurs besoins. La femme et la jeune fille (femme à devenir) sont les sources de vies humaines. Préservez leur intégrité c'est sauvegarder des générations présentes et à venir saines et fortes."

properties.title: Jacqueline Uwimana
properties.description: "I am committed to ensuring that the needs of women and girls are prioritized in emergencies, so that resources are available to establish peace and assist them in emergencies. Violence against women and girls is common and permitted, with impunity. Advocacy will not only enable us to have more access to the survivors and give them more care, but will also help bring about behavioral change within communities. Our work in emergencies has to stimulate this change. It must also foster collaboration between actors and inspire them to take action to end violence against women and girls."

properties.title: Inés Oleaga
properties.description: "Je suis une femme très heureuse et ne me changerais pour personne.Pour quoi il y a tellement des personnes dans la détresse ? La dégradation humaine à laquelle les filles et femmes sont exposés autour de moi m’oblige sans choix à m’engager d’avantage pour soulager sa souffrance, pour mettre en place tous les moyens possibles pour prioriser sa protection et promotion, convaincue que la félicité est aussi pour elles."

properties.title: Inés Oleaga
properties.description: "Je suis une femme très heureuse et ne me changerais pour personne.Pour quoi il y a tellement des personnes dans la détresse ? La dégradation humaine à laquelle les filles et femmes sont exposés autour de moi m’oblige sans choix à m’engager d’avantage pour soulager sa souffrance, pour mettre en place tous les moyens possibles pour prioriser sa protection et promotion, convaincue que la félicité est aussi pour elles."

properties.title: Frédéric Lulizene
properties.description: "Je me suis donné pour mission de veiller à ce que les besoins des femmes et des filles soient traités en priorité en situations d’urgence car elles sont les garantes de la génération nouvelle malgré les événements les ciblant davantage."

properties.title: Léonie Faïla Kahigwa
properties.description: "Selon moi, il est fondamental de renforcer les capacités de la communauté humanitaire pour évaluer et satisfaire les besoins des femmes et des filles en situations d'urgence car la communauté humanitaire à ces jours traite des besoins des populations sans accent particulier aux besoins des femmes et des filles. Je pense que nous pouvons, et devrions, faire davantage pour assurer la sécurité des femmes et des filles en situation d’urgence en impliquant les communautés à veiller à leurs besoins. La femme et la jeune fille (femme à devenir) sont les sources de vies humaines. Préservez leur intégrité c'est sauvegarder des générations présentes et à venir saines et fortes."

properties.title: Margaret Iiraut Aleper
properties.description: "I am committed to ensuring that the needs of women and girls are prioritized in emergencies because women and girls are the most affected due to their sex, nature of their work like looking after children, collecting firewood, fetching water and they are sole providers in communities. In emergencies women and girls are defenseless and some time they become the most vulnerable group among the affected communities. Women and girls’ needs in emergencies are ignored by communities and even service providers."

properties.title: Saly Eponon
properties.description: "Selon moi, il est fondamental de renforcer les capacités de la communauté humanitaire pour évaluer et satisfaire les besoins des femmes et des filles en situations d'urgence car. Elles sont visées en tant que tel avec un accroissement de leur vulnérabilité."

properties.title: Andre Baruti
properties.description: "Je me suis donné pour mission de veiller à ce que les besoins des femmes et des filles soient traités en priorité en situations d’urgence car sauver une femme c'est sauver une nation."

properties.title: Bertille Kamole
properties.description: "Je me suis donné pour mission de veiller à ce que les besoins des femmes et des filles soient traités en priorité en situations d’urgence car elles sont souvent oublies dans le paquet d’assistance des personnes survivantes des catastrophes ou des guerres, ces dernières  ont des besoins plus particulières peut etre mêmes petites mais importantes pour leur vies et les conséquences sont souvent très fatales."

properties.title: Mathy Furaha
properties.description: "Les femmes et fille ont besoin de plud de soins et de protection en situation d'urgence, elles sont cible des violences vulnerable."

properties.title: Daniel Katumbi
properties.description: "La contribution de toute l’humanité dans la lutte contre les violences faites aux femmes et filles est importante pour relever les défis y afférents et donner aux femmes et filles leur valeur réel."

properties.title: Tamah Murfet
properties.description: "I am committed to prioritizing the needs of women and girls in emergencies because – being perceived as being less urgent than other immediate needs – theirs are often neglected. Supporting and protecting women and girls is both crucial and urgent in emergency situations, when they are more vulnerable than ever; it represents a life-saving intervention that helps reestablish individual dignity and capacity, as well as supporting community rehabilitation."

properties.title: Jean Nimubona
properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because it is not only the right thing to do, but it is crucial for humanitarian well-being and development."

properties.title: Nyasha Mutongwizo
properties.description: "I feel that we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because over time emergencies shall continue to occur:  man-made or natural disasters. The prioritization of women and girls' protection is, therefore, a commitment needed from all. In an emergency setting, pre-existing vulnerabilities are exacerbated. Not everyone is equally vulnerable. We can and should do so much more in preparedness and response to address disparities in vulnerability."

properties.title: Nyasha Mutongwizo
properties.description: "I feel that we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because over time emergencies shall continue to occur:  man-made or natural disasters. The prioritization of women and girls' protection is, therefore, a commitment needed from all. In an emergency setting, pre-existing vulnerabilities are exacerbated. Not everyone is equally vulnerable. We can and should do so much more in preparedness and response to address disparities in vulnerability."

properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because they play a pivotal role in society. We must help them rebuild their sense of belonging. I am struck most by their courage and will to go on living without giving up. These women and girls ask themselves many questions about their future, but also find the answers themselves."

properties.description: "I believe that building the humanitarian community’s capacity to recognize and address the needs of women and girls in emergencies is critical because safeguarding their dignity and empowerment is a crucial and vital ingredient for rebuilding of a nation. In general, the status of women and girls is trivialized, thus, making their ability to thrive in emergency situations a challenge. But, sustainable development can only be achieved when women and girls have access to knowledge, protection and resources."

properties.description: "I believe that building the humanitarian community’s capacity to recognize and address the needs of women and girls in emergencies is critical because SGBV cases are often neglected during emergency response and it is really important that humanitarian workers should be able to advocate and respond effectively in this sense."

properties.title: Serge Dalexis
properties.description: "Selon moi, il est fondamental de renforcer les capacités de la communauté humanitaire pour répondre aux besoins des femmes et des filles en situations d'urgence car elles ne vivent pas les mêmes expériences. Il est primordial de veiller à ce que leurs besoins soient."

properties.title: Harriet Kezaabu
properties.description: "I am committed to ensuring that the needs of women and girls are prioritized in emergencies because of their defenselessness and susceptibility to greater risk of sexual and economic exploitation. This infringes on their human rights and greatly impedes the woman’s dignity. Regardless of emergency situations, women and girls deserve equal access to resources and services like their male counterparts."

properties.title: Dr. Job Makoyo
properties.description: "I believe that building the humanitarian community’s capacity to recognize and address the needs of women and girls in emergencies is critical because women and girls’ needs during emergencies have not been prioritized and many continue to suffer due to the inability of humanitarian actors to adequately respond."

properties.title: Dr. Cris Baguma
properties.description: "Si un humain mérite d’être honoré, c’est d’abord la femme. Elle mérite honneur, respect, protection et considération."

properties.title: Acire Geoffrey Agula
properties.description: "I am committed to ensuring that the needs of women and girls are prioritized in emergencies because it is a life saving intervention."

properties.title: Henrietta F. Punni
properties.description: "I am committed to ensuring that the needs of women and girls are prioritized in emergencies because they have multiple needs during crisis, and are not prioritized for immediate support. Women and girls often suffer additional violence in seeking to access care and support."

properties.title: Gedi Mohamed
properties.description: "We need to develop friendly programs to cater for women and girls in emergencies. I believe we can de-stigmatise GBV by winning the trust of the Women and Girls that we serve. And the way to go is for them to know we offer friendly services and also maintain high levels of Privacy and Confidentiality".

properties.title: Gedi Mohamed
properties.description: "We need to develop friendly programs to cater for women and girls in emergencies. I believe we can de-stigmatise GBV by winning the trust of the Women and Girls that we serve. And the way to go is for them to know we offer friendly services and also maintain high levels of Privacy and Confidentiality".

properties.title: Kelly Kisarch
properties.description: "Emergency situations, be it from man-made disasters like civil wars or natural calamities like earthquakes, floods and landslides often envelop the unique sufferings that women and girls experience. An emergency response plan that identifies unique needs of women and girls from the onset of an emergency is not only life saving, but also critical in ensuring that the right services are accessible and that the rights of women and girls are respected and promoted during emergency and recovery period.”

properties.title: Saa Eric Dentor
properties.description: "I believe that building the humanitarian community’s capacity to recognize and address the needs of women and girls in emergencies is critical because women and girls are more vulnerable to sexual violence including rape, exploitation and abuse, forced prostitution and other forms of GBV due to their dependency for survival and lack of socio-economic opportunities."

properties.title: Lucie Sunday Adagi
properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because of their vulnerability that makes them carry the burden of the society.  Seeing so many child headed families as result of customs and the scourge of HIV, creates a deep passion in me to advocate for this women and girls."

properties.title: June Wahome
properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in an emergency because they have unique vulnerabilities to the greater population. Women and girls have limited access to information and due to power dynamics between men and women are often not given a chance to take active roles in decision making process - even their own lives. As a result of this cultural and situational factors, women and girls are easily targets for sexual violence and exploitation."

properties.title: Widad Hamed
properties.description: "I believe that building the humanitarian community’s capacity to recognize and address the needs of women and girls in emergencies is critical because we can ensure the timely response to the needs, prevent violence and preserve women and girl’s dignity and rights for an honored life."

properties.title: George Njeru
properties.description: "Thousands continue to suffer in silence and only a fraction of these cases come to our knowledge and get the appropriate support. As the world continue to experience a huge numbers of disasters more and more families continue to be seriously affected and as we all know in disasters women and girls are among the most at risk groups and its only calls for more innovative and new ways to address these challenges."

properties.title: Francesca Rivelli
properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because they constitute the majority of a population after a crisis (especially if a men-lead crisis), they are the engine of the economic reconstruction through their daily business activities, and they are the 'glue' to keep together the social fabric."

properties.title: Amanda Lanzarone
properties.description: "I am committed to ensuring that the needs of women and girls are prioritized in emergencies because women play integral roles in the health of families, of communities and of local economies. I believe that communities flourish when women are safe, healthy and leading productive lives."

properties.title: Tharaphi Aung
properties.description: "I believe that building the humanitarian community’s capacity to recognize and address the needs of women and girls in emergencies is critical because many of them are ignored and powerless."

properties.title: Dr. Sein Hlaing
properties.description: "In the context of armed conflict and displacement due to natural or human made disasters, sexual violence is a well known and high risk problem mainly targeting civilian women and girls. They are at high risk of severe and long-lasting health problems and psychosocial complications from stigmatization and discrimination of their societies. Thus it is critical that holistic emergency humanitarian support for women and girls are implemented."

properties.title: Lucas Ngigi
properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because – more often than not – responding to the emergency becomes the most important aspect in the intervention. This makes women and girls vulnerable, as their safety is not prioritized."

properties.title: Lucas Ngigi
properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because – more often than not – responding to the emergency becomes the most important aspect in the intervention. This makes women and girls vulnerable, as their safety is not prioritized."

properties.title: Kelly Kisarch
properties.description: "Emergency situations, be it from man-made disasters like civil wars or natural calamities like earthquakes, floods and landslides often envelop the unique sufferings that women and girls experience. Women and girls often suffer additional violence in seeking to access care and support."

properties.title: Dr. Cris Baguma
properties.description: "Si un humain mérite d’être honoré, c’est d’abord la femme. Elle mérite honneur, respect, protection et considération."

properties.title: Grace Chirewa
properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because emergencies, by their very nature, weaken the safety nets for women and girls.  The vulnerability of girls is, thereby, increased.  Many protection incidents fall through the cracks as most women and girls are unaware that they can get help and protection from abuse and may not know where to go in order to access the wide range of services available."

properties.title: Hubert  Zirimwabagabo
properties.description: "I believe that building the humanitarian community’s capacity to recognize and address the needs of women and girls in emergencies is critical because SGBV cases are often neglected during emergency response and it is really important that humanitarian workers should be able to advocate and respond effectively in this sense."

properties.title: Mirella Papinutto
properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because they play a pivotal role in society. We must help them rebuild their sense of belonging. I am struck most by their courage and will to go on living without giving up. These women and girls ask themselves many questions about their future, but also find the answers themselves."

properties.title: Dr. Job Makoyo
properties.description: "I believe that building the humanitarian community’s capacity to recognize and address the needs of women and girls in emergencies is critical because women and girls’ needs during emergencies have not been prioritized and many continue to suffer due to the inability of humanitarian actors to adequately respond."

properties.title: Jacinta Maingi
properties.description: "I believe that building the humanitarian community’s capacity to recognize and address the needs of women and girls in emergencies is critical because safeguarding their dignity and empowerment is a crucial and vital ingredient for rebuilding of a nation. In general, the status of women and girls is trivialized, thus, making their ability to thrive in emergency situations a challenge. But, sustainable development can only be achieved when women and girls have access to knowledge, protection and resources."

properties.title: Nyasha Mutongwizo
properties.description: "I feel that we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because over time emergencies shall continue to occur:  man-made or natural disasters. The prioritization of women and girls' protection is, therefore, a commitment needed from all. In an emergency setting, pre-existing vulnerabilities are exacerbated. Not everyone is equally vulnerable. We can and should do so much more in preparedness and response to address disparities in vulnerability."

properties.title: Serge Dalexis
properties.description: "Selon moi, il est fondamental de renforcer les capacités de la communauté humanitaire pour répondre aux besoins des femmes et des filles en situations d'urgence car elles ne vivent pas les mêmes expériences. Il est primordial de veiller à ce que leurs besoins soient."

properties.title: Tamah Murfet
properties.description: "I am committed to prioritizing the needs of women and girls in emergencies because – being perceived as being less urgent than other immediate needs – theirs are often neglected. Supporting and protecting women and girls is both crucial and urgent in emergency situations, when they are more vulnerable than ever; it represents a life-saving intervention that helps reestablish individual dignity and capacity, as well as supporting community rehabilitation."

properties.title: Mathy Furaha
properties.description: "Les femmes et fille ont besoin de plud de soins et de protection en situation d'urgence, elles sont cible des violences vulnerable."

properties.title: Nyasha Mutongwizo
properties.description: "I feel that we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because over time emergencies shall continue to occur:  man-made or natural disasters. The prioritization of women and girls' protection is, therefore, a commitment needed from all. In an emergency setting, pre-existing vulnerabilities are exacerbated. Not everyone is equally vulnerable. We can and should do so much more in preparedness and response to address disparities in vulnerability."

properties.title: Jean Nimubona
properties.description: "I feel we can and should do more to keep women and girls safe in emergencies because it is not only the right thing to do, but it is crucial for humanitarian well-being and development."

properties.title: Daniel Katumbi
properties.description: "La contribution de toute l’humanité dans la lutte contre les violences faites aux femmes et filles est importante pour relever les défis y afférents et donner aux femmes et filles leur valeur réel."

properties.title: Léonie Faïla Kahigwa
properties.description: "Selon moi, il est fondamental de renforcer les capacités de la communauté humanitaire pour évaluer et satisfaire les besoins des femmes et des filles en situations d'urgence car la communauté humanitaire à ces jours traite des besoins des populations sans accent particulier aux besoins des femmes et des filles. Je pense que nous pouvons, et devrions, faire davantage pour assurer la sécurité des femmes et des filles en situation d’urgence en impliquant les communautés à veiller à leurs besoins. La femme et la jeune fille (femme à devenir) sont les sources de vies humaines. Préservez leur intégrité c'est sauvegarder des générations présentes et à venir saines et fortes."

properties.title: Margaret Iiraut Aleper
properties.description: "I am committed to ensuring that the needs of women and girls are prioritized in emergencies because women and girls are the most affected due to their sex, nature of their work like looking after children, collecting firewood, fetching water and they are sole providers in communities. In emergencies women and girls are defenseless and some time they become the most vulnerable group among the affected communities. Women and girls’ needs in emergencies are ignored by communities and even service providers."

properties.title: Andre Baruti
properties.description: "Je me suis donné pour mission de veiller à ce que les besoins des femmes et des filles soient traités en priorité en situations d’urgence car sauver une femme c'est sauver une nation."

properties.title: Saly Eponon
properties.description: "Selon moi, il est fondamental de renforcer les capacités de la communauté humanitaire pour évaluer et satisfaire les besoins des femmes et des filles en situations d'urgence car. Elles sont visées en tant que tel avec un accroissement de leur vulnérabilité."

properties.title: Bertille Kamole
properties.description: "Je me suis donné pour mission de veiller à ce que les besoins des femmes et des filles soient traités en priorité en situations d’urgence car elles sont souvent oublies dans le paquet d’assistance des personnes survivantes des catastrophes ou des guerres, ces dernières  ont des besoins plus particulières peut etre mêmes petites mais importantes pour leur vies et les conséquences sont souvent très fatales."

properties.title: Inés Oleaga
properties.description: "Je suis une femme très heureuse et ne me changerais pour personne.Pour quoi il y a tellement des personnes dans la détresse ? La dégradation humaine à laquelle les filles et femmes sont exposés autour de moi m’oblige sans choix à m’engager d’avantage pour soulager sa souffrance, pour mettre en place tous les moyens possibles pour prioriser sa protection et promotion, convaincue que la félicité est aussi pour elles."

properties.title: Frédéric Lulizene
properties.description: "Je me suis donné pour mission de veiller à ce que les besoins des femmes et des filles soient traités en priorité en situations d’urgence car elles sont les garantes de la génération nouvelle malgré les événements les ciblant davantage."
